item.title: ErgoDox EZ LEGO tenting kits
item.author:
contact@wonyoungjang.org
(Wonyoung Jang)
item.description: Purpose link h2 My ErgoDox EZ came with some tenting legs, but they suffer from two main problems: They are individually adjusted with thumbscrews, which can be finnicky The maximum tenting may not be as extreme as you might like With a custom tenting kit, I wanted to build one that’s easily adjustable (one adjustment “move” per side of keyboard), and one that you can easily take the keyboard off of when desired.

item.title: Pit signs for robotics competition
item.author:
contact@wonyoungjang.org
(Wonyoung Jang)
item.description: Pit signs link h2 At one of my past employers, we ran large robotics competitions. For one such competition, we customized and printed these “pit signs” for each team participating in the competition. The teams could then take them home at the end. I’ve templated these signs so anybody may create similar ones. Figma Design Kit
